City, a-frame vr scene, city at night
Make sure everything is in a single HTML file with embedded CSS and JS in a single code block to be used as a web app.

Creating a simple A-Frame VR scene of a city at night can be done using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Below is a complete HTML file that you can use as a web app. This example includes a basic cityscape with buildings, a night sky, and some lights to create a nighttime atmosphere.

```html
<!DOCTYPE html>
<html lang="en">
<head>
    <meta charset="UTF-8">
    <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1.0">
    <title>City at Night - A-Frame VR</title>
    <script src="https://aframe.io/releases/1.2.0/aframe.min.js"></script>
    <style>
        body {
            margin: 0;
            overflow: hidden;
        }
        a-scene {
            height: 100vh;
        }
    </style>
</head>
<body>
    <a-scene>
        <!-- Sky -->
        <a-sky color="#000000"></a-sky>

        <!-- Ground -->
        <a-plane position="0 -0.5 0" rotation="-90 0 0" width="1000" height="1000" color="#444444"></a-plane>

        <!-- Buildings -->
        <a-box position="-3 0.5 -5" depth="1" height="3" width="2" color="#8B8B8B" shadow></a-box>
        <a-box position="-1 1 -5" depth="1" height="5" width="2" color="#A9A9A9" shadow></a-box>
        <a-box position="1 0.75 -5" depth="1" height="4" width="2" color="#696969" shadow></a-box>
        <a-box position="3 1.5 -5" depth="1" height="6" width="2" color="#C0C0C0" shadow></a-box>

        <!-- Lights -->
        <a-light type="ambient" color="#ffffff" intensity="0.2"></a-light>
        <a-light type="point" position="-3 3 -5" color="#ffcc00" intensity="1" distance="10"></a-light>
        <a-light type="point" position="-1 5 -5" color="#ffcc00" intensity="1" distance="10"></a-light>
        <a-light type="point" position="1 4 -5" color="#ffcc00" intensity="1" distance="10"></a-light>
        <a-light type="point" position="3 6 -5" color="#ffcc00" intensity="1" distance="10"></a-light>

        <!-- Camera -->
        <a-entity camera look-controls position="0 1.6 0"></a-entity>
    </a-scene>
</body>
</html>
```

### Instructions to Use:
1. Copy the above code into a text editor.
2. Save the file with a `.html` extension, for example, `city-at-night.html`.
3. Open the file in a web browser that supports WebVR (like Chrome or Firefox).
4. You can use a VR headset or simply explore the scene using your mouse or keyboard.

### Features:
- A dark sky to simulate night.
- A ground plane to represent the city floor.
- Several buildings with different heights and colors.
- Ambient and point lights to create a nighttime effect.

Feel free to modify the positions, colors, and sizes of the elements to create your own unique cityscape!
